content:
User: The Terraform install created it's own directory in AI-Execution-System. Is this where it goes? Or do I create a separate folder for the deployment files?
Attached 1 file.
- image_8731a3.png

Gemini: Yes, you can use that existing terraform folder inside AI-Execution-System to create your deployment files.

Here's what I recommend for simplicity and keeping things organized:

Navigate to the AI-Execution-System directory.
Go INSIDE the existing terraform folder.
Within this terraform folder, create your Terraform configuration files (.tf files).
In other words, YES, the C:\AI-Execution-System\terraform\ directory shown in your image is a good place to put your Terraform configuration files for deploying ai-system-backend-v2.

Your terraform directory structure for deployment files will then look like this:

AI-Execution-System/
└── terraform/         # <---  Put your deployment files HERE
    ├── main.tf
    ├── variables.tf
    ├── outputs.tf
    ├── providers.tf
    └── ... (other .tf files and modules if needed)
You do not need to create a separate folder outside of AI-Execution-System for deployment files. Keeping them inside the existing terraform directory within your project root is perfectly acceptable and keeps everything related to your AI execution system project contained within the AI-Execution-System directory.

Just to reiterate to be super clear: The terraform folder in your image becomes your Terraform configuration directory for this deployment, not just the Terraform installation location.

Let me know if this makes sense or if you have any other questions! Ready to get those Terraform files configured and deployed! LFG!
